name: acsmred
params: class c0, class c1, wff w0

stmt.origin: syl(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(c0, cfv(cacs, c1)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(cacs, c1)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cacs, c1)), wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈(Moore ` c1))
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈(ACS ` c1))
⊣ (c0 ∈(ACS ` c1)→ c0 ∈(Moore ` c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(cacs, c1)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cacs, c1)), wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈(Moore ` c1))
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈(ACS ` c1))
⊣ (c0 ∈(ACS ` c1)→ c0 ∈(Moore ` c1))

body.origin: |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cacs, c1)), wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(cacs, c1)))

comment: An algebraic closure system is also a Moore system. Deduction form of ~ acsmre . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
